post_text: Meet Meredith Huxtable, First Grade: BIA is one of the most dynamic and unique schools at which I have worked in my 23-year teaching career. The faculty and staff are warm and welcoming. The administration has been very helpful in assisting me with learning all of the platforms that BIA uses. The school has a PBL (Project Based Learning) charter, which allows students to learn all subjects in conjunction with each other. It also allows students to take ownership of their learning and make it meaningful to them. Students learn responsibility, collaboration, and project management. All of these skills are preparing them for adult life. In addition, the positive energy is palpable at BIA. Parents are active, students are happy and learning, and teachers are supportive. I would recommend BIA to anyone looking for a positive environment in which children are learning important skills in both academics and social arenas.

post_text: "Today we flew to Wakayama, which is a one hour flight southwest from Tokyo. Upon our arrival, we had a traditional ramen lunch at the airport and then toured a factory for Kao Industries, which produces home and personal care products (similar to Proctor & Gamble). We then were given an orientation of the area by a local government official. Later in the afternoon we toured Wakayama Castle, a 16th century hilltop fortress used by the samurai warriors of the time. Dinner featured sushi at a restaurant in the hotel. Following dinner we rehearsed for our presentation and performance at the school visit tomorrow. The students were given their home stay assignments and are looking forward to meeting their host families tomorrow evening." ~Jennifer Bradley, BIA Academic Instructional Coach
